definition: shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

soul/mortal soul, i.e. attached to the body

sentences.english: Through this exhibition item, we can experience a "thrilling journey into space".
sentences.chinese: 通過本展項，將可進行一場驚心動魄的太空之旅。

sentences.chinese: 衝突過後，往往是驚心動魄和異常悲慘的經歷。

sentences.english: The chilly wind bleak, staged a thrilling scene of supernatural events.
sentences.chinese: 陰風慘淡的港府，上演着一幕幕驚心動魄的靈異事件。

sentences.english: Near unexpectedly is such an soul-stirring.

sentences.english: Noise in general becomes more striking, with waves slapping more determinedly at our sides.

sentences.english: The thieves led police on a heart-pounding car chase through the city.

sentences.english: Ever notice that most dreams have a blood-surging urgency to them?

sentences.english: They immediately undertook the heart-stirring battle to prevent the landslide.

sentences.english: Collection of the world’s fastest, tallest and the most scariest roller coasters .
sentences.chinese: 看，世界十大最高最快最酷最驚心動魄的過山車。

sentences.english: He seasoned after such a soul-stirring incident.

sentences.english: The history of a country's public finance is quite a  revealing one.
sentences.chinese: 其實，一個國家的財政史是驚心動魄的。
